This is a thread about Persistent Rotation, not KSP 2.

For all, I've finished my changes and submitted a PR to [@MarkusA380](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/45759-markusa380/) .  Now it's up to him.

I've made a development build, you can download it here:

[https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/PersistentRotation/releases](https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/PersistentRotation/releases)

**Changes**

- Merged in localization chagnes from github user @6DBYZBX, includes both english and chinese
- Replaced toolbar code with the Toolbarcontroller
- Added ClickThroughBlocker
- Removed buttons referencing specific button (toolbar or stock)
- Added button referencing generic toolbar
- Added new .version file (Upgraded)
- Added LGG local build files

**Dependencies**

- [SpaceTuxLibrary](https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/SpaceTuxLibrary/releases)
- [Click Through Blocker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/170747-141-click-through-blocker/)
- [ToolbarController](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/169509-141-toolbar-controller-for-modders/)
Could this be used to keep something like an orbiting space station in a specific orientation during timewarp?

I've adopted this mod here:

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedauthorid="129964" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed6096967677" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/201121-19x-110x-111x-persistent-rotation-upgraded/&do=embed"></iframe>

Entering timewarp or reloading a recent quicksave where <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System"><abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr></abbr> is enabled causes vessels in space to point north the moment physics happens, then it shatters into many pieces going between a few dozen kilometers a second to light speed. I've fixed PersThrust not letting me timewarp and now the game has resorted to blowing stuff up, so I'm a bit scared to see what happens next.
